course_name: Graduate Diploma in Women's and Children's Health
overview:
This comprehensive Graduate Diploma in of Women’s and Children’s Health prepares midwives, nurses and allied health practitioners to advance their careers in a range of diverse and challenging roles. Developed in close consultation with experts and industry stakeholders, core subjects in women’s health provide contemporary and responsive content that is industry aligned, evidence-based and research-informed, ensuring that graduates are well prepared to meet the current and future needs of women’s health.

Specialisations in, reproductive health, leadership, and research enable students to develop skills and knowledge in their area of interest.

This course is designed to prepare students to assume roles in leadership, research, and advanced practice in a wide range of health services and facilities. The course encourages students to critically reflect on current healthcare models, and whether they are meeting the needs of the diverse populations in our community. The content aims to develop skills in working with a range of people, systems, and processes within health services and drive system-level change that meets the dynamic needs of communities, clinicians, governments and organisations. The fully online study mode allows students to personalise their learning, with flexible study options.
awards: Graduate Diploma in Women's and Children's Health (GradDipWomenChldH)

learning_outcomes.text: Demonstrate critical thinking to systematically evaluate current practice, policy and research relating to women’s and children’s health care and health outcomes.
Collaborate and lead to innovate and achieve optimal outcomes in women’s and children’s health.
Apply, promote and justify principles of social justice and accountability to ensure equity of access to healthcare when engaging with key stakeholders.
Communicate effectively and respectfully in diverse situations.
Plan for ongoing professional development to support practice.

notes: This is an exit-only course. There is no direct admission to it. Current UTS students may be able to submit an Internal Course Transfer (Graduating) application to exit with this course. See the Course transfer page for further details.
admission_requirements: None; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
career_options:
The Graduate Diploma in Women’s and Children’s Health appeals to midwives, nurses and allied health professionals such as general practitioners, social workers, psychologists, dietitians and nutritionists, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, speech pathologists and other allied health professionals who wish to expand their current clinical knowledge and experience and focus their career on supporting the health needs of women and children.

The course supports graduates to pursue roles in:
course_structure: Students must complete a total of 48 credit points, comprising seven core subjects offered by UTS: Health, and two electives offered by UTS: Health
